A nice, good, and lightweight classical zombie shooter ! Push your way through the level fulled with zombies ! One zombie at a time, one safe room at a day ! The mods compability is awesome ! You can really mess the game to your liking, with tons of different mod ! A must play for you zombie shooter fans !

This game is the worst thing I've ever set my beady eye-spheres on. There are like, 4 models of common infected so the developers just went HAM on the copy and paste action. 
Special infected? More like special needs! 
The tank is an absolute moron, just stand on the opposite side of some stairs and he loses his mind trying to get over the metre high banister that separates you.

I'd definitely choose Left 4 Dead 2 over this game, the sequel just seems to be more vibrant and more balls to the wall than this one.

If you are an avid fan of the zombie shooter subgenre, I would... uh, actually, I have no idea if this game would satisfy you.  I myself am [i]not[/i] crazy about zombie shooters, or zombie movies, or zombie lunchboxes, T-shirts, collectable commemorative dinner plates, etc., etc., but I [i]have[/i] been addicted to this game for a decade now.  I have World War Z and Dying Light and so on, which all have better graphics and juicy, needlessly violent kill animations and larger, more intricate campaigns, but I don't go back to any of them the way I do with L4D (and, to a lesser extent, L4D2).

I find the stripped down, simplified gameplay very well balanced and engaging, compared to the more modern zombie shooters.  It is second-to-second action that demands your complete attention, yet also encourages and rewards strategy.  Each campaign (scenario, really) is concise, with identical, formulaic objectives:  Get to Safe House 1, then 2, then 3, then hold off the horde until "rescue" arrives.  The more of you that survive, the better--simple as that. Certain non-horde zombies have special forms of attack, and if a player is incapacitated by any of them, they [i]must[/i] be rescued by a teammate to survive.  Kills, rescues and other metrics are tallied, and so, with repeated plays-through, it becomes a question of how well you prevail as much as if you prevail.  Just like an old-fashioned arcade game or tournament-style shooter. 

The 4 playable characters each have distinct personalities, and will utter amusing remarks appropriate to each of them respectively, but aside from small, establishing cutscenes, and a general, logical progression through the official campaigns, there is very little "storytelling", per se.  The overall aesthetics, including soundtrack, present the gameplay as scenes from some mid-budget zombie movie, but no actual "narrative" is ever forced upon you.  In other words, this is, first and foremost, a [b]game[/b].

I have nothing to say about the "versus" or "survival" modes, because I have never bothered with them.  I should also disclose that I have never played the game in actual co-op mode.  My 3 companions have always been bots that I have managed (and tried to keep alive) throughout the campaign.  I am perfectly satisfied playing this game solo, although I'm sure if I could tear any of my friends away from mastering their careers or enrolling their kids in university, the co-op game would also be a blast.

Finally, there is a wealth of readily available mod campaigns that can be easily added to the base game that greatly expands the scope and variety of the challenges.  Some are new environments (e.g. mountains, industrial ports, alien structures) some are mapped from actual cities (e.g. Vienna, Osaka), some are recreations of settings from other games (e.g. Half-Life's Black Mesa and Ravenholm, the Silent Hill locales, Resident Evil)...  If you burn through the official campaigns, you can carry on with the better mods for years.  Or play Left for Dead 2.

L4D is a zombie based first person shooter, Louis is a pill addict, Francis is a rejected artist, Zoey is a journalist from Australia, and Bill is dead

This isn't really any different from L4D2, but it's a great game anyway. After all, it's where it started.

Honestly, just get Left4Dead2, it has more players, more workshop items and sometimes it gets updated.

The games will never disappoint me, if you don't own this one and are thinking about buying it, buy left 4 dead 2 instead because it has like 40x the playerbase of this one and the content from this game is included in left 4 dead 2.

uno de los mejores  juegos de zombien, aunque con algunas carencias de armas y jugabilidad un pco repetitiva. se trata claramente de 4 sobrevivientes y que lleva al jugador a poder jugarlo de dos formas la primera será solo y en su forma cooperativa. considero que para las fechas en las que nos encontramos, es un muy buen juego para adquirirlo cuando se encuentre en oferta pero no seria un juego que lo compraria al valor que hoy dia tiene. Mis conclusiones son un 9/10.
Left 4 Dead is solid. From the co-op features to the gun play everything feels dialed. The game play is fast paced and tense.

[h1] NOTA E ANÁLISE [/h1]
10 - L4D foi um jogo lançada em 2008 mas que com certeza não se tornou datado. Sendo o grande responsável pelo BOOM de jogos e séries sobre zumbis, este se consagra como o pai deste gênero (Apesar de não ter sido o primeiro jogo sobre tal, mas sendo o que popularizou tudo isto). O jogo é divertido de se jogar sozinho e extremamente viciante de se jogar com os amigos em multiplayer e/ou em seu modo Versus (Modo único e super interessante, no qual 2 times jogam uma hora como sobreviventes e outra como infectados especias), possuindo até hoje (2020) uma comunidade super ativa e vários servidores com jogadores.
Se você é fã do gênero de zumbis ou do gênero de FPS é obrigatório você passar por este jogo e se você não curte estes gêneros, mesmo assim vale dar uma chance a este game (Recomendo jogar com amigos). Recomendo esperar uma promoção, na qual quase sempre está com até 80% de desconto.
